channel.title: Weight
channel.description:
<ItemDropDef> <id>466</id> <amount>1</amount> <weight>0</weight> </ItemDropDef>
Does anybody know how the weight correctly works for percentage of drop rate?
0 being 100% I'm taking a wild guess at 100 being the very rare percentage?

item.title: Weight
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

Yet again that fucking numpty trys to troll me and gets trolled by the community…

@xEnt it seemed that way when i was adding up but was un-sure. Seems as though when i kept the -1 in soon as the npc died it crashed the server, thats where i realised theres more too it, obviously since it was designed for RSCA. I appreaciate the info.

Read full topic

item.title: Weight
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“freaky5000, post:6, topic:436310”]Thanks for the info guys.

RSCAngeldrop.exe - It puts a drop at the bottom -1 any idea why? or is it to balance the missing percentages?[/quote]

i think that’s what it does, can’t remember 100% sure though.

you also need to add something in your Npc.java killedBy method,

this is taken from MoparClassic:

				for (ItemDropDef drop : drops) {
					if (drop == null) {
						continue;
					}
					if (drop.getWeight() == 0) {
						world.registerItem(new Item(drop.getID(), getX(),
								getY(), drop.getAmount(), owner));
						continue;
					}

					if (hit >= total && hit < (total + drop.getWeight())) {
						if (drop.getID() != -1) {
							if (EntityHandler.getItemDef(drop.getID()).members
									&& World.isMembers()) {
								world.registerItem(new Item(drop.getID(),
										getX(), getY(), drop.getAmount(), owner));
								break;
							}
							if (!EntityHandler.getItemDef(drop.getID()).members) {
								world.registerItem(new Item(drop.getID(),
										getX(), getY(), drop.getAmount(), owner));
								break;
							}
						}
					}
					total += drop.getWeight();
				}

Read full topic

Kryptix:

[quote author=-Nothing link=topic=539030.msg3944677#msg3944677 date=1331754018]Why would I do anything productive, RSC is dead, trying to do anything with it is just waste of time.

There’s 220 players online RSCE right now and I see that as nothing, I’m confident 3x the amount of people will play RSCD on a regular basis.

RSC is far from dead, you just suck at keeping it alive.[/quote]
+1

item.title: Weight
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“Vicd, post:3, topic:436310”]1% chance drop rate is quite high tbh.
How can you get it lower, does decimals work?[/quote]
you could always double the output to 200, and keep the 1

item 575, weight 1
item 404, weight 99
item 200, weight 100

therefore
575 is 0.5% now.

Read full topic

item.title: Weight
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

the way I learned it was, when adding drops for a new npc, make sure that all the weight combined for the certain npc equaled 100, that way, each drop weight was in percentage.

example: npc 1
item 575, weight 1
item 404, weight 49
item 200, weight 50

now, item 575 has a 1% chance to be dropped, 404 has 49% chance, and 200 has 50% chance. notice all combined equal 100

Read full topic
